alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Sublette (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 11:13AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .Warmer temperatures will allow for high-elevation snowmelt to continue. Automated snowpack estimates reveal about 6.5 inches of water remaining in the snowpack in the mountains around 9,500 feet west of La Barge. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Green River near La Barge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor flooding of low lying agricultural land next to gage. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Nearby homes begin to see high water. Fields south of town around the gaging station have ponded water (less than 1 foot deep). * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Tuesday, June 6, the stage was remaining nearly steady at 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to hover around 8.6 feet through Wednesday before beginning a gradual decline into the weekend, while still remaining above action stage. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay away from riverbanks, which may be eroded by the fast-moving water and could easily collapse. Please report observed flooding to local law enforcement or emergency management and request the information be shared with the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
